author: EggbertNoBacon7
body:
Here's Mine. All opinions/recommendations/questions welcome.

*Nvidia	3.45%
*Accenture	4.46%
*Alphabet	5.88%
*Apple	11.48%
*Ferrari	5.66%
*Intel	2.92%
*Mastercard	7.78%
*Nike	3.30%
*Ralph Lauren	1.53%
*Taylor Wimpey	1.26%
*Persimmon	3.49%
*Ubisoft	1.57%
*Hays	1.96%
*Admiral	5.00%
*Moneysupermarket	4.99%
*Rightmove	3.42%
*Unilever	7.51%
*William Hill	2.83%
*GSK	2.30%
*Burberry	5.26%
*Applied Mat.	6.59%
*BAE Systems	7.34%

I have been analysing stocks for a number of years, but only actively started investing in individual securities (as opposed to hedge funds and ETFs) on 11/03/2019. My current ROI to date is 18.34%.

author: therealsparticus
body: Working for in the Auto industry in SV, we see that Tesla has alot of problems but Ford and GM  hire Accenture to write unmaintainable code and expect partners to work with it and proudly trout their 10k page requirements documents. I wouldn't be surprised if they just can't get their software to together.

author: blastr007
body: But if you're young it's fine for stock to go way down hen you just buy more and more. Still if you want maybe pharma, I'd pick ABBV for the long haul, maybe ACN, SO, and a REIT and stick with it. But personally I'd recommend Vanguard retirement fund of the year you want to retire, put in monthly, check in yearly and have fun in life.
